intro: Licaria ibarrae, commonly known as the Ibarra's licaria, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Licaria ibarrae is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
